content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

function extract_julia_code(md::String)::String
    # Split the markdown document into individual lines
    lines = split(md, "\n")

    # Initialize an empty string to store the extracted code
    code = ""

    # Iterate over each line in the markdown document
    for line in lines
        # Check if the current line is a Julia code block
        if startswith(line, "```julia")
            # Set a flag to indicate that we are currently inside a code block
            inside_code_block = true
        end

        # If we are currently inside a code block, append the line to the code string
        if inside_code_block
            code *= line * "\n"
        end

        # Check if the current line is the closing fence for a Julia code block
        if startswith(line, "```") && !startswith(line, "```julia")
            # Set the flag to indicate that we are no longer inside a code block
            inside_code_block = false
        end
    end

    # Join all the extracted Julia code blocks together with a newline
    return join(split(code, "\n"), "\n")
end
